group_1.narration: I specialize in Metamorphosis...@The magic of "impersonation".
Using this magic,@I asked around in Lady Cornelia's house,@and as a result...

group_1.textCenter: The person who took the basket with Lady@Miyurin's tabula... no, phone.
It was Lady Cornelia's father who moved it@out of the room.

group_1.textRight: Well then, well then! What happened?

group_1.textLeft: Apparently, inside the basket was some antique@jewelry that he had collected on his travels.
From what they told me,
it sounds like he had just left the house to present@them to a jeweler from appraisal.

group_1.textRight: He must be a very well-to-do man indeed,
to ever store his valuables in such an@artless manner...
At any rate, we've found its whereabouts.@Thank you, Amaryllis.
That being said, don't you have to return to Junia?

group_1.textLeft: I very much do, yes...but things are as they seem.
Worst case scenario,
it would only jeopardize my position as@Lady Junia's handmaiden...
On that note, Lady Cornelia, shouldn't you@be lunching...?

group_1.textRight: I hardly think we have time for that right now.
You have a date with Marius this afternoon,@don'tcha?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, Lord Marius will be here very soon.
Lady Cornelia, you must get ready to leave...
Oh, Father...
I was told you went to see a jeweler.

group_1.textRight: Well, I've asked him to appraise some of the@antiques I've been accumulating.
I don't recall where I bought it, but there is@quite a rarity mixed in.
One of our young clients was there and@wanted to buy it.

group_1.textLeft: A rarity? Could it be...

group_1.narration: My ominous premonition was confirmed...@The rarity was Miyurin-sama's phone item.

group_1.textLeft: ...If I may ask, who is the kind client who@wants to buy it...?

group_1.textRight: A young man named Gaius.
He's a nephew of Admiral Pliny of the Roman Navy.

group_1.narration: Pliny the Elder...@A famous military man and naturalist@who published a great work, "Naturalis Historia".
Actually, we have a bit of a connection with him as well,@but that's for another story.
His nephew, Lord Gaius...is only about@the same age as Lord Marius.
I hear that in the future he will be called@"Pliny the Younger", a name that will remain with him@for 2000 years to come...

group_1.textRight: This may really be coming to a point of@serious emergency.

group_1.textLeft: That's what it looks like...

group_1.textRight: As the nephew of Pliny the Elder,
Gaius has probably stopped by the port to scavenge@for unusual items on behalf of his busy uncle.

group_1.textLeft: ...Which means,
the contents of Miyu's phone were also seen@by him in the process, right?

group_1.textRight: Yes.
And that alone brings us already close to the@worst case scenario I could have imagined...
At this rate, a modern smartphone will end up@in the hands of Pliny the Elder,
one of the foremost luminaries of this era.
Truly,
never have I anticipated such a precipitous@surge in the tides of this crisis.

group_1.textLeft: ...I want to disappear alreadyyy...
It's that problematic...?

group_1.textRight: ..."Naturalis Historia" should still be being@written as we speak.
If the description of a smartphone becomes@written in "Naturalis Historia",
records that did not exist in the future as we@know it will appear...
In other words...a huge time paradox of@2000 years will occur.
And Gaius, later known as Pliny the Younger,@is a renowned littérateur himself.
It would also be troublesome if he himself left a@description of the phone in his writing.

group_1.textLeft: "Screwed" on top of "screwed", we must be@"super screwed"...
Just how screwed are we?

group_1.textRight: I don't know... On one hand, a time paradox may@come along and wipe out the universe...

group_1.textLeft: Whaaa— Such a catastrophe?!

group_1.textRight: On the other hand, even if a description of a@smart phone were to be written,
it may be buried deep under other contents and@therefore make no impact.
After all,
there are far more extraordinary things documented@in "Naturalis Historia" than a smartphone.
My fears could well prove to be unfounded,@and I hope they are, but...

group_1.textLeft: Better to be ready for the worst, anyway, yeah?
I-isn't that right...?
It's just...
Lord Marius will be here soon...
What in Zeuxis' name are we supposed to do?!

group_1.textRight: Calm yourself. If you panic, you'll lose.@Just like in Ludus.
It's when there's no time left to lose that you@have to be graceful... Isn't that right?

group_1.textLeft: Lady Cornelia...!
